Program main

    implicit none

    integer*8 :: position, nrstSeqStartIndx, startIndex, result_first, new_number, temp, count
    integer :: digits_count, i
    integer, dimension(20) :: digits

    ! Read input
    read(*,*) position

    ! First part: compute result_first
    nrstSeqStartIndx =1
    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx *2) < position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx *2
    end do

    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx +1) <= position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx +1
    end do

    startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)
    result_first = (position - startIndex) +1

    ! Second part: process result_first into new_number
    digits_count =0
    current_x = result_first

    do while (current_x >0)
        integer :: r, new_digit, x_before
        r = mod(current_x,10)
        x_before = current_x
        if (x_before /10 ==0) then
            if (9 - r ==0) then
                new_digit = r
            else
                if (9 - r < r) then
                    new_digit =9 -r
                else
                    new_digit =r
                end if
            end if
        else
            if (9 - r < r) then
                new_digit =9 -r
            else
                new_digit =r
            end if
        end if
        digits_count = digits_count +1
        digits(digits_count) = new_digit
        current_x = current_x /10
    end do

    new_number =0
    do i=1, digits_count
        new_number = new_number *10 + digits(i)
    end do

    ! Third part: count 1's in binary
    count =0
    temp = new_number
    do while (temp >0)
        if (mod(temp,2) ==1) then
            count = count +1
        end if
        temp = temp /2
    end do

    ! Output the count
    print*, count

contains

    integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)
        integer*8, intent(in) :: index
        getValueAtIndex = 1 + (index -1)*index /2
    end function getValueAtIndex

end program main

Now, putting all together:

The full Fortran program would be:

program main
    implicit none

    integer*8 :: position, nrstSeqStartIndx, startIndex, result_first, new_number, temp, count, current_x, x_before
    integer :: digits_count, i, r, new_digit
    integer, dimension(20) :: digits

    ! Read input
    read(*,*) position

    ! First part: compute result_first
    nrstSeqStartIndx = 1
    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx * 2) < position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx * 2
    end do

    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx + 1) <= position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx + 1
    end do

    startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)
    result_first = (position - startIndex) + 1

    ! Second part: process result_first into new_number
    digits_count = 0
    current_x = result_first

    do while (current_x > 0)
        r = mod(current_x, 10)
        x_before = current_x
        if (x_before / 10 == 0) then
            if (9 - r == 0) then
                new_digit = r
            else
                if (9 - r < r) then
                    new_digit = 9 - r
                else
                    new_digit = r
                end if
            end if
        else
            if (9 - r < r) then
                new_digit = 9 - r
            else
                new_digit = r
            end if
        end if
        digits_count = digits_count + 1
        digits(digits_count) = new_digit
        current_x = current_x / 10
    end do

    new_number = 0
    do i = 1, digits_count
        new_number = new_number * 10 + digits(i)
    end do

    ! Third part: count 1's in binary
    count = 0
    temp = new_number
    do while (temp > 0)
        if (mod(temp, 2) == 1) then
            count = count + 1
        end if
        temp = temp / 2
    end do

    ! Output the count
    print*, count

contains

    integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)
        integer*8, intent(in) :: index
        getValueAtIndex = 1 + (index - 1) * index / 2
    end function getValueAtIndex

end program main
